description: Unique row identifier for this labor cost transaction log entry.
Code indicating the type of cost posting (e.g., original, adjustment, reversal); likely enumerated; confirm with SME.
Identifier for the technicianâ€™s trade/skill classification billed for the work; likely references a craft table.
Number of labor hours recorded for this transaction.
Total monetary cost posted for the recorded labor on this transaction.
Pay category applied to the hours (e.g., regular, overtime, double-time); likely coded; confirm with SME.
User or system process that created or posted this transaction.
Identifier of the employee or technician whose labor is being charged.
Identifier of the asset or equipment the labor was performed on.
Reference to a maintenance procedure or task list performed; likely a procedure ID; confirm with SME.
Project or job identifier to which this labor cost is charged, if applicable.
General Ledger account charged for this labor cost.
Indicator or reference for splitting cost across multiple GL accounts; likely an allocation detail; confirm with SME.
Work order associated with the labor transaction.
Purchase order linked to this labor (e.g., contracted labor), if applicable.
Timestamp when the labor cost transaction was logged.
Timestamp when an adjustment or final posting for this transaction occurred; confirm exact use with SME.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Free-text notes describing the work or reason for the cost or adjustment.
Optional classification code tied to this transaction; meaning depends on code_type; confirm with SME.
Type/category that defines how the associated code should be interpreted (e.g., reason, failure, cost class).
Timestamp when a user last modified this record (distinct from system updates); naming suggests user-specific audit; confirm with SME.
Work order accounts payable reference (e.g., AP batch or invoice link) related to this labor cost; likely; confirm with SME.
Reference or flag for actual AP posting against the work order for this labor; likely; confirm with SME.
Reference to the purchase order header associated with this labor, if applicable; confirm with SME.
Reference to the PO receipt transaction tied to this labor, if applicable.
Line number on the associated purchase order, if applicable.
Line number on the associated PO receipt, if applicable.
Labor rate applied per hour for this transaction.
User who originally created this record.
Timestamp when this record was created by a user.
User who last modified this record.
Timestamp when this record was last modified by a user.
